meanings.definition: Belief in the abolition of all government and the organization of society on a voluntary, cooperative basis.
meanings.sent1: Some people support anarchisms because they want a society without rulers.
meanings.sent2: Anarchisms advocate for a system where people work together without a central authority.
meanings.sent3: The idea of anarchisms can lead to interesting debates about governance.
meanings.sent4: In a world of anarchisms, every individual would be their own leader.
meanings.sent5: The concept of anarchisms envisions a community built on mutual respect and collaboration.

meanings.definition: The theory or doctrine that all forms of government are oppressive and undesirable.
meanings.sent1: Anarchisms argue that governments tend to restrict personal freedom.
meanings.sent2: Critics of anarchisms believe that some level of government is necessary for order.
meanings.sent3: Discussing anarchisms can sometimes lead to lively conversations about authority.
meanings.sent4: The philosophy of anarchisms challenges traditional views on governance.
meanings.sent5: Anarchisms highlight the potential dangers of centralized power in society.
